lines.text: [Nicole describes the burglar to her Papa]
Well, it was pitch dark and there he was. Tall, blue eyes, slim, quite good-looking... in a brutal, mean way, Papa. A terrible man!
Your arm is much better.
Oh no no, it hurts, it hurts.
It's the other arm.
The infection is spreading.
I can't drive a stolen car!
Same principle, four gears forward, one reverse.

[to Nicole, in the museum]
Okay, you're the boss. Just do as I tell you.
Why must it be this particular work of art?
You don't think I'd steal something that didn't belong to me, do you?
Excuse me, I spoke without thinking.
[Evaluating Nicole's cleaning-woman costume]
Yes, that's fine. That does it.
Does what?
Well, for one thing, it gives Givenchy a night off.
I feel like I'm going to faint!
Don't, there's no room.
I didn't want to keep you waiting, so I got engaged to him. Is it alright? Am I on time?
Perfectly. In fact, we have ten more minutes, so if you want to go back and marry him?

[reviving Nicole from her faint]
I'm the one that's bleeding!
Don't you know that in his lifetime Van Gogh only sold one painting? While I, in loving memory of his tragic genius, have already sold two.
For a burglar you're not very brave, are you?
I'm a society burglar. I don't expect people to rush about shooting me!
like an idiot I forgot to wear gloves on the job. I may have left some fingerprints. Be an angel. Before you go to bed, just give the frame of the painting a little wipe with a clean cloth, ok?
Certainly. Anything else? You wouldn't like a forged passport or some counterfeit money or...
Oh, no no no.
You're mad. Utterly mad. I suppose you want to kiss me goodnight?
Oh, I don't usually, not on the first acquaintance, but you've been such a good sport...
[he kisses her, she resists at first, than yields]

[to the taxi driver]
38, Rue Parmentier, drive carefully.
[to Nicole]
Get a good night's sleep.
I want you to take a long look at the trees, the blue sky, and the river, all of which I personally loathe, which is why a juicy stretch in a French prison doesn't bother me at all.

[stuck in the closet with Simon]
I didn't think there'd be this much togetherness.
Well, it's the height of the tourist season. Everything was book up. It was the best I could do.

[Simon has opened the door]
Marvelous!
No applause, please.
There's the bathroom, take off your clothes.
Are we planning the same sort of crime?
This tall, good-looking ruffian with blue eyes, he didn't, er, molest you in any way, did he?
[Nicole is staring off dreamily]
Well, did he?
Not much.
I doubt very much if Van Gogh himself would have gone through so much trouble.
He didn't have to. He was Van Gogh!
Don't be such a baby, it's only a flesh wound!
Happens to be my flesh.
Where precisely were you in the early part of the sixteenth century?
I don't know but that's not how I was dressed.
All right, where to?
The Ritz.
The what?
The Hotel Ritz. It's in the Place Vendôme.
I know where it is. You're a very chic burglar.

[nodding his head in a agreement]
Mmmhmmm.
It's National Crime Prevention Week. Take a burglar to dinner.

[crazy Senor Paravideo comes as Nicole and Simon are leaving]
Who's that?

[obviously lying]
Papa's cousin... from South America!
You know for someone who started lying recently, you're showing a real flair!
Oh thank you!
[she hugs him]
Our telephones may be tapped, so I'll conduct this entire conversation in Swahili. How are you?
I keep telling you, Papa, when you sell a fake masterpiece, that is a crime!
But I don't sell them to poor people, only to millionaires.
You really are the smuggest and most hateful man.

[being introduced to the museum head]
Miss Bonnet and I are old friends. We used to shoot together.

[seeing Simon eye the Venus]
You wouldn't dare!
Fear not. I'm off duty.

[bumping into Nicole at the museum]
Good morning! We meet under the most artistic circumstances.

[regarding the Venus]
It's a fake, isn't it?
No long drawn out stories at this time of night. Just simply nod your head yes or no.
What have I done? I've given the world a precious opportunity of studying and viewing the Cellini Venus.
Which is not by Cellini!
Ahh, labels, labels. It's working with the Americans that's given you this obsession with labels and brand names. I wish you'd give up that ridiculous job.
My dirt!
I know about their so called tests.
Papa, they aren't so called they are!
Papa, I caught a burglar!
Of course you did!
Look, it's early, why don't I show you the real Paris?
That's very kind of you, but I live here; I was born in Paris.
Oh, that's right, I forgot. Well why don't you show me the real Paris.
Why don't you wait till you get it home and steal it then? No muss, no fuss, just a nice clean inside job? I'd be happy to offer my services.
GO!
[pauses]
And meet me at the museum at five-thirty sharp. And don't ask me why or I'll hit you with a bucket!
Yours is a capricious nature. Do you always blow hot and cold like this?

[after leaving a book with some coins inside]
Watch for normal human reactions!
I tossed a coin on the way over. *You* lost.

[about the Cellini Venus]
Oh! She's fine. She's wrapped up in one of my old shirts, just as snug as could be. I rocked her to sleep in my arms last night. It's the first time I ever did that with a grandmother.
American millionaires must be all quite mad. Perhaps it's something they put in the ink when they print the money.
Is this how you normally work, by the mile?
all wrinkled!
I would like to remind you, Mr. Dermott; ours is a business relationship.

[Nicole screeches to a hault in Simon's hotel garage]
Well, we made it here alive.

[describing Nicole's grandmother who posed for the Venus]
Naturally that was before she started eating those enormous lunches.
That thing isn't loaded is it?
Course it is.
[cocks the gun]
Are you armed?

[regarding his wound]
This should keep me out of action for a week!
Oh dear havens. I'll call you a taxi! And pay for it is that alright!
That's fine. However, if the police find my car parked outside your house. It could mean questions. I'm wanted you know.
Alright, I'll drive you home, is that alright?

[having just driven Simon home]
Now how do I get home?
You see, you never can tell when you might need a friend.

[to Davis Leland]
I'm sorry you fell in love with the Venus, but she's not for sale! But believe me if she were mine she'd be on your doorstep in the morning!
By the way sir, would you like to be present at the technical examination?
Tech-technical examination?

[after telling Nicole he won't help her]
Oh don't you dare cry!
I"m not I've got something in my eye!
There's nothing wrong with your eye. You're crying to try and soften me up.
It's not true!
It won't work. I'm too tough!

[staring to change into her disguise]
Turn around.
What for?
[realizing what she means]
They go on over the clothes!
Indian wrestling at a time like this?
There's the bathroom. Take off your clothes.
Are we planning the same sort of crime?
You're quite safe. It's dress rehearsal time. That's why we bought all this lovely junk.
